When does it end? How many lives do we lose before we realize we're all exactly the same at the core?
This was a crime of patriarchy. How dare she reject this man of greater wealth/power than her? He felt disrespected and took action.
In a world with an ever-increasing wealth gap, stories like this happen in our immediate vicinity. Stories we remain largely oblivious to.
It's highly unlikely that this man will get charged. We've somehow managed to create a society where a human life is worthless.
She spoke of all this non-chalantly. Like it happens every day. The sad part? It does happen every day. This story isn't out of the ordinary
She didn't go to school past the 8th grade. She and her sisters would get harassed on their way. Their parents felt it safer to drop out.
Her ex and his family still believe there's room for reconciliation. They want her to get back together with him.
The local police officer she told her story to, immediately after her father was killed, now claims she never told him anything.
They've filed a lawsuit in the Karachi Supreme Court. The ex and his family have successfully delayed proceedings for 4.5 months.
She's in Islamabad now, where her maternal aunt connected her with a women's trust. This isn't the first story like this they've seen.
She wasn't offered food or water during this journey. Ditto for the kid brother. The body had started to decay, she remembers the smell.
The 16yo traveled from near Karachi to Islamabad (a 3-day trip) in an ambulance along with her father's dead body. Her 2yo brother was with.
She has since found out that her mother was electrocuted and suffered from temporary memory loss. She has burn marks on her forehead.
His family then took her mother away and tried to hide her father's body. She explained to the local police everything that had taken place.
The father, still alive after the accident was then murdered by this man, while everyone looked on. She saw it happen.
He didn't take to the rejection well and set out to seek revenge on the parents. The girl's father got into an "accident" shortly after.
She was betrothed to a man who was being verbally abusive to her, so she broke it off with him. Her parents were supportive.
I just heard this story first-hand and my heart hurts. A 16yo girl fled from a village in Sindh after witnessing her own father's death.
@jtroll @duolingo is awesome and so under appreciated.
This past year, some of the best people I know have made the choice to pursue a dream. May this year bring those dreams closer. #thirdwave
